case_title: Sardar MUHAMMAD ANWAR KHAN vs AZAD JAMMU AND KASHMIR GOVERNMENT and 8 others
court_name: Azad Jammu and Kashmir Service Tribunal
key_issues: Challenge to Government Notification No. SM/P(1)123/903-15/84 dated 25-4-1984 regarding promotion of Tehsildars to Extra-Assistant Commissioners.
Eligibility criteria for inclusion in Select List 'A' under Azad Jammu and Kashmir Extra-Assistant Commissioner Service Rules, 1980.
Time-barred appeal and limitation period under Service Tribunal Act.
Merit and ability as criteria for promotion.

claims: Entered service earlier than respondents and was senior.
Graduated and qualified departmental examination, making him eligible for promotion.
Criteria of graduation before 1980 violated rules.
requests: Set aside or amend Select List 'A' to include appellant's name.

claims: Appellant was not qualified at the time of list preparation.
Promotion based on merit and ability, not seniority.

relevant_rules: Azad Jammu and Kashmir Extra-Assistant Commissioner Service Rules, 1980

tribunal_findings.time_limitation: Appeal against order dated 8-7-1984 was not filed within the prescribed period.
tribunal_findings.qualification_criteria: Selection Board's criteria of graduation before 1980 was not violative of rules.
tribunal_findings.merit_and_ability: Selection Authority has discretion to impose conditions and prioritize merit over seniority.

decision.summary: Appeals dismissed due to lack of merit and violation of rules not established.
